location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.3980 of 1854 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is an acknowledgement of receipt of Kemball’s earlier letter (folios 219-20) relating to the question of responsibility over the retrieval of indigo from the shipwrecked and plundered vessel Centaur. Anderson writes that the Government approves of Kemball’s letter to the Insurance Committee at Calcutta, and forwards for Kemball’s information, a letter (no.3450, folio 224) from George Edmonstone, Secretary to the Government of India, to Anderson, dated 11 August 1854, confirming that Kemball’s letter has been approved of and passed on.
